scenarioDescription:
The Wendelstein-1 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Wendelstein-1 is a star with 0.65 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.61 times its radius. It is located 995.75 light years away from the solar system.

Wendelstein-1 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Wendelstein-1 system


Wendelstein-1 b

Wendelstein-1 b was discovered by the Haleakala Observatory observatory, in 2020-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Wendelstein-1 b is 188.256 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Wendelstein-1 b is 11.561 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Wendelstein-1 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Wendelstein-1, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haleakala Observatory.
name: Wendelstein-1 - System With 1 Exoplanet
